intro: Tylophora coilolepis, commonly known as the spiral-stemmed tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy surface. Tylophora coilolepis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
